page.title: 20Impressions of Lydlinch
page.content:
When we first started to look at our area somebody joked that it hadn't changed since the original Domesday Book was compiled.In essence they were right.The Church and the pub are still the main social features and the area is still very much rural and agricultural.The same family names can be found on the tombstones as on the modern electoral roll.We wonder if it will have caught up at all in the next 900 years!
This block was surveyed and recorded by members of {Bridge Methodist Youth Club
from Sturminster Newton.
